posts.post_content:
Green [Segovian Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Segovian Leviathan) / [Rock Badger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rock Badger).  
  
I think the reason why Green, which has otherwise efficient creatures, keeps getting bad forestwalkers is that the green-on-green mirror match is so evasion- and removal-poor. Forestwalkers become game-winners in the resulting standoff, in a way that a mountainwalker never could.

posts.post_content:
In my comment for the [Surrakar Banisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surrakar Banisher), I said that i wouldn't mind a 3/3 creature on the field. However, I feel like this would be an exception. Green normally has creatures with P/T fairly similar to/close to its CMC, but sometimes there are creatures that are either smaller or larger, such as [Hollowhenge Beast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hollowhenge Beast), [Enormous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enormous Baloth), [Centaur Courser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Centaur Courser), etc. Green also has its evasive creatures, which normally isn't that small compared to its CMC either, such as [Somberwald Dryad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Somberwald Dryad), [Orchard Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orchard Spirit), [Glissa's Courier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glissa's Courier), etc. This, however, is fairly small and conditional compared to others of its CMC, which is rather disappointing.  
2/5
posts.html:
In my comment for the Surrakar Banisher, I said that i wouldn't mind a 3/3 creature on the field. However, I feel like this would be an exception. Green normally has creatures with P/T fairly similar to/close to its CMC, but sometimes there are creatures that are either smaller or larger, such as Hollowhenge Beast, Enormous Baloth, Centaur Courser, etc. Green also has its evasive creatures, which normally isn't that small compared to its CMC either, such as Somberwald Dryad, Orchard Spirit, Glissa's Courier, etc. This, however, is fairly small and conditional compared to others of its CMC, which is rather disappointing.
2/5
